pullRequest.body:
Introduce HomeomorphClass

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ HomeomorphClass`
`+ coe_coe`
`+ instance : HomeomorphClass (α ≃ₜ β) α β`
`+ instance [HomeomorphClass F α β] : CoeOut F (α ≃ₜ β)`
`+ instance [HomeomorphClass F α β] : ContinuousMapClass F α β`
`+ toHomeomorph`
`+ toHomeomorph_injective`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
I would say that an instance to `ContinuousMapClass` should be provided, but I'm surprised that this file doesn't import `Topology.ContinuousMap.Defs`.

> ContinuousMapClass

So where should I add this, I have no idea.
I think it's fine to import `Topology.ContinuousMap.Defs` here. It's lightweight and this file is pretty large and should probably be split at some point in the future anyway.

> I think it's fine to import `Topology.ContinuousMap.Defs` here. It's lightweight and this file is pretty large and should probably be split at some point in the future anyway.

I think this PR is relative small, and I don't think leave it there and just let the mess grow is a very good idea, what about I just split `Homeomorph.lean` in this PR or I start a new one about it right now and resolve it once and for all. This would probably also unwind the import graph a bit.

If you want to make a new PR splitting this file, go for it. I just didn't want to force you to do it.

I would suggest doing this in stages. First, create a PR which moves this to `Mathlib/Topology/Homeomorph/Basic.lean`. Then create a second PR which splits that file into (at least) a `Defs` file and maybe some others.

I just add this import for now, I'll deal the splitting latter.
Another question: should I add the coercion from `HomeomorphClass F A B` to `ContinuousMapClass F B A` (the other side)?
No, that would break things.

Sorry that I am not familiar with these things and doesn't know what things look like downsteam, beside, is  `ContinuousSemilinearEquivClass` you mentioned also mixing algebra and topology and should be reconstructed? If so, that would be a big work and I probably wouldn't be able to work on it soon.
Can you please add instances of this class downstream (e.g., for `ContinuousSemilinearEquivClass`, and anything else that makes sense)?

Thanks for this addition! Can you please also add the analogue of this lemma, and address my comments below?
```lean
@[simp]
theorem RingHom.coe_coe {α : Type u_2} {β : Type u_3} :
∀ {x : NonAssocSemiring α} {x_1 : NonAssocSemiring β} {F : Type u_5} [inst : FunLike F α β]
  [inst_1 : RingHomClass F α β] (f : F), ⇑↑f = ⇑f
```
Can you please add instances of this class downstream (e.g., for `ContinuousSemilinearEquivClass`, and anything else that makes sense)?

```suggestion
/-- `HomeomorphClass F A B` states that `F` is a type of homeomorphisms. -/
```

You need to give it the `@[coe]` attribute so that it will actually show up in the infoview as an uparrow. This is also necessary for interaction with `norm_cast`.
```suggestion
/-- Turn an element of a type `F` satisfying `HomeomorphClass F α β` into an actual
`Homeomorph`. This is declared as the default coercion from `F` to `α ≃ₜ β`. -/
@[coe]
```

In case you haven't seen it yet, you may want to see the [style guide](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/style.html)
```suggestion
def toHomeomorph [h : HomeomorphClass F α β] (f : F) : α ≃ₜ β :=
  { (f : α ≃ β) with
    continuous_toFun := h.continuous_toFun f
    continuous_invFun := h.continuous_invFun f }
```

please ask on Zulip what is the correct class to use here. `CoeTC` is not preferred (although it's littered throughout Mathlib). We need to come to a consensus on Zulip about which `Coe` class is best for coercions from morphism classes to morphisms.
Asked in a thread of PR review, needed anywhere else?

The correct choice if you want to infer the left argument from the right is `CoeOut`. So:
```suggestion
instance [HomeomorphClass F α β] : CoeOut F (α ≃ₜ β) :=
  ⟨HomeomorphClass.toHomeomorph⟩
```
I don't think we have this for other morphism classes. I suspect it's not necessary as we can just apply the coercion to functions and then use `DFunLike.coe_injective` (probably after `simp`)
I copied this lemma from `MulEquivClass`, I didn't think carefully whether it is useful.
Okay, it's fine to leave it then; perhaps it's useful. We don't have this lemma for most other coercions to morphisms though (which is why I didn't think it was likely to be useful).

```suggestion
  map_continuous : ∀ (f : F), Continuous f
  inv_continuous : ∀ (f : F), Continuous (h.inv f)
```

Make them consistent with the current naming.

https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/b14fe2c87e1a03a66514f49dc1f50d1c06f5e74d/Mathlib/Topology/Algebra/Module/Basic.lean#L284-L285

pullRequest.title: feat(Topology): Introduce HomeomorphClass
